Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.annotations
Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.annotations.analysis

Interface HpoOnsetDistribution

All Known Implementing Classes:
HpoOnsetDistributionSimple
public interface HpoOnsetDistribution
This interface represents all HpoOnset annotations for a disease. This includes a list of global HpoOnset annotations that describe the age at which the disease was first brought to medical attention Some of these annotations have frequencies such as 3/7, meaning that say 3 out of 7 patients in a cohort study had disease onset at "Childhood onset (HP:??)". Some diseases additionally have onset information for individual disease features. Implementations of this interface may optionally use this information to provide results about the global onset. For instance, if a disease does not have a global onset annotation but does have an annotation for a phenotypic feature, then we can use this for the global annotation. In some cases, no onset information is available, and implementations need to decide what to do.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default boolean
    isObservableInAge(HpoDisease disease, PointInTime age)
    This method can be used to determine whether a patient (as represented in a Phenopacket, for example) has come to medical attention at an age that corresponds to what we expect for a disease.

    probabilityOfPresentationAtAge(HpoDisease disease, TemporalInterval interval)
    This method can return a probability of a patient presenting at the indicated age if the patient has the disease.

  • Method Details

    • isObservableInAge

      boolean isObservableInAge(HpoDisease disease, TemporalInterval interval)
      This method can be used to determine whether a patient (as represented in a Phenopacket, for example) has come to medical attention at an Age that corresponds to what we expect for a disease. For instance, an implementation could return true if the age is within one of the HPO Onset terms used to annotate a disease, otherwise false
      Parameters:
      interval - representing the age of a patient
      Returns:
      true if the age corresponds to the onset information of the disease

    • isObservableInAge

      default boolean isObservableInAge(HpoDisease disease, PointInTime age)
      This method can be used to determine whether a patient (as represented in a Phenopacket, for example) has come to medical attention at an age that corresponds to what we expect for a disease. For instance, an implementation could return true if the age is within one of the HPO Onset terms used to annotate a disease, otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      age - of the patient
      Returns:
      true if the age corresponds to the onset information of the disease

    • probabilityOfPresentationAtAge

      default double probabilityOfPresentationAtAge(HpoDisease disease, TemporalInterval interval)
      This method can return a probability of a patient presenting at the indicated age if the patient has the disease. By default, we return 1.0 if the patient is within the age range, otherwise zero, but implementations can implement more sophisticated probability distributions.
      Parameters:
      interval - representing the age of a patient
